paragraph.paragraph: The Empty Project Wizard allow you to add a new "empty" EiffelEnvision Project to an active or new Visual Studio .NET vxconVisualStudioSolutionsProjects 0 Solution
The wizard is separated into two pages. Overview and System Settings. You may switch between the pages by clicking on the name of the page, located in the wizard's left pane.

The Overview page presents a basic overview of what is going to be generated for the project. The information detailed on this page reflects the information set of the System Settings page. If the defaults do not meet with your requirements, then please use the System Settings page to make the necessary changes.

The System Settings page allows you to modify the settings for the system created when the wizard is completed. The following settings may be modified:
Root Class - Root class of the Eiffel system. A class of this name will be generated for inclusion in the system Root Feature - Root feature of the Eiffel system. A feature of this name will be generated in the class Root Class. The root feature is the feature executed when the system is launched. Project Type - The type of project to generate.
Root Class
This options corresponds to the ../../../configuration/build.xmlroot_classRoot Class property from the ../../../configuration/build.xmlBuild Project Properties. The urlclassclass name specified must be a valid Eiffel class name. This field is a required field and may not be left empty of contain any illegal characters
Creation Routine
This options corresponds to the ../../../configuration/build.xmlcreation_routineCreation Routine property from the ../../../configuration/build.xmlBuild Project Properties. The urlfeaturefeature name specified must be a valid Eiffel feature name. This field is a required field and may not be left empty of contain any illegal characters
Project Type
This setting is to dictate the type of project to create. Application (.exe) will generate a project that can be executed, Library (.dll) will create a project that is destined to be reused by one or more applications or other libraries.

2 Completing the Wizard
Once you have set the appropriate settings for the new project, clicking Finish will create a new EiffelEnvision ../../../structure/index.xmlProject containing a single class with the name specified in the Root Class option. The class will contain a urlcreationcreation routine with the name specified in the Creation Routine option.
